intro: Dicalix microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited dicalix, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. Its leaves are ovate with a serrated margin, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
